summary: Collects hybrid-selection (HS) metrics for a SAM or BAM file.

arguments.summary: Allele fraction for which to calculate theoretical sensitivity.
arguments.name: --ALLELE_FRACTION

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: An interval list file that contains the locations of the baits used.
arguments.name: --BAIT_INTERVALS

arguments.summary: Bait set name. If not provided it is inferred from the filename of the bait intervals.
arguments.name: --BAIT_SET_NAME

arguments.summary: True if we are to clip overlapping reads, false otherwise.
arguments.name: --CLIP_OVERLAPPING_READS

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Parameter to set a max coverage limit for Theoretical Sensitivity calculations. Default is 200.
arguments.name: --COVERAGE_CAP

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: If true count inserted bases as on target and deleted bases as covered by a read.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_INDELS

arguments.summary: An aligned SAM or BAM file.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The level(s) at which to accumulate metrics.
arguments.name: --METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Minimum base quality for a base to contribute coverage.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_BASE_QUALITY

arguments.summary: Minimum mapping quality for a read to contribute coverage.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_MAPPING_QUALITY

arguments.summary: The maximum distance between a read and the nearest probe/bait/amplicon for the read to be considered 'near probe' and included in percent selected.
arguments.name: --NEAR_DISTANCE

arguments.summary: The output file to write the metrics to.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: An optional file to output per base coverage information to. The per-base file contains one line per target base and can grow very large. It is not recommended for use with large target sets.
arguments.name: --PER_BASE_COVERAGE

arguments.summary: An optional file to output per target coverage information to.
arguments.name: --PER_TARGET_COVERAGE

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: Sample Size used for Theoretical Het Sensitivity sampling. Default is 10000.
arguments.name: --SAMPLE_SIZE

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: An interval list file that contains the locations of the targets.
arguments.name: --TARGET_INTERVALS

arguments.summary: Output for Theoretical Sensitivity metrics where the allele fractions are provided by the ALLELE_FRACTION argument.
arguments.name: --THEORETICAL_SENSITIVITY_OUTPUT

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
This tool takes a SAM/BAM file input and collects metrics that are specific for sequence datasets generated through hybrid-selection. Hybrid-selection (HS) is the most commonly used technique to capture exon-specific sequences for targeted sequencing experiments such as exome sequencing; for more information, please see the corresponding GATK Dictionary entry.

This tool requires an aligned SAM or BAM file as well as bait and target interval files in Picard interval_list format. You should use the bait and interval files that correspond to the capture kit that was used to generate the capture libraries for sequencing, which can generally be obtained from the kit manufacturer. If the baits and target intervals are provided in BED format, you can convert them to the Picard interval_list format using Picard's BedToInterval tool.

If a reference sequence is provided, this program will calculate both AT_DROPOUT and GC_DROPOUT metrics. Dropout metrics are an attempt to measure the reduced representation of reads, in regions that deviate from 50% G/C content. This reduction in the number of aligned reads is due to the increased numbers of errors associated with sequencing regions with excessive or deficient numbers of G/C bases, ultimately leading to poor mapping efficiencies and low coverage in the affected regions.

If you are interested in getting G/C content and mean sequence depth information for every target interval, use the PER_TARGET_COVERAGE option.

Note: Metrics labeled as percentages are actually expressed as fractions!

Usage Example:

 java -jar picard.jar CollectHsMetrics \\

       I=input_reds.bam \\

       O=output_hs_metrics.txt \\
"
       R=reference.fasta \\

       BAIT_INTERVALS=bait.interval_list \\

       TARGET_INTERVALS=target.interval_list

Please see CollectHsMetrics for detailed descriptions of the output metrics produced by this tool.

See HsMetricCollector and CollectTargetedMetrics for more details.
name: CollectHsMetrics (Picard)
